Package Components

Class Input

java.lang.Object
Components.Input
public class Input extends Object
Handles application input.

    • toInteger

      public Integer toInteger() throws NumberFormatException
      Converts the user's response into an Integer.
      Returns:
      the response as an integer.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if response cannot be converted.

    • toBoolean

      public Boolean toBoolean()
      Converts the user's response to a boolean, such that "yes" is true, and any other response is considered false.
      Returns:
      true if response == "yes", otherwise false.

    • toDouble

      public Double toDouble() throws NumberFormatException
      Returns:
      response as a Double.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the user's response cannot be converted.

      Gets the last user response received.

      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the response given to expect(String) or query(String).

    • toString

      public String toString(String regex, String explanation) throws IllegalStateException
      Gets the last user response given if the response matches the given regular expression.
      Parameters:
      regex - the regular expression to match the response to.
      explanation - the explanation to use if the input does not match regex.
      Returns:
      the response given to expect(String) or query(String).
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if response does not match regex.

    • getInstance

      public static Input getInstance(BufferedReader reader)
      Instantiates a new Input object if no Input objects are in scope.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      Input object.
